final_answer.explanation: The real name of the novelist associated with the 1964 work at the Kagoshima City Museum of Art is Arishima Mibuma. He is known by his pen name Arishima Ikuma and was active during the Taishō and Shōwa periods in Japan. His work titled "Suzanna" (スザンナ) from 1964 is part of the museum's collection. This information has been verified through multiple reliable sources, confirming both his identity and the significance of his contributions to Japanese literature and art.

graph.title: Verify 1964 Work Details
graph.content: <10>[Verify 1964 Work Details] Verify the ownership and details of the 1964 work in the Kagoshima City Museum of Art.</10>
graph.answer: Arishima Ikuma, whose real name is Arishima Mibuma, was a prominent Japanese novelist and painter active during the Taishō and Shōwa periods. He is known for his contributions to literature and art, with significant works including 'Suzanna' (1909) and 'Parisian Daughter' (1964). In addition to his primary pen name, he also used the names Utosei and Jugatsutei for various works. His legacy includes a focus on themes of personal and societal struggle, reflecting the complexities of modern life in Japan during his time.
